results.title: Planet earth: the Hidden earth
results.brief_description: Traces the history of studies of the earth’s interior. Explains the significance of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. Discusses theories regarding the solar system and the changes in the earth’s surface. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Planet earth: radio waves [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Discusses the electromagnetic spectrum, the history of its discovery, the theory and research done on radio waves and the ionosphere which girdles the earth. Explains the ionosphere, how it is explored and used for radio communications, and the new science of radio-astronomy which is probing far beyond our galaxy.

results.title: Planet earth: magnetic force
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Using animation and time-lapse photography this film demonstrates how the geophysicist, using modern instruments, aeroplanes and rockets, studies, measures and maps the earth’s magnetic fields and observes the effects of sun spots and the associated auroras. Includes excellent footage of magnetic storms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)

results.title: Planet earth. Part 1. Secrets of the ice
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: The study of glacier ice by scientists in many parts of the world to obtain information on past climate and the changing climate of today, the delicate balance between ice and water on which depends the level of the sea, and how the earth itself was shaped through geological time.

results.title: Plane mates
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie and Kenneth S. Cox
results.brief_description: A dramatised story for children showing the wide interest in and use of aircraft in Australia. Shows aerial ambulance, radio-controlled model planes, a trip in a light plane over Sydney and finally the Qantas jets. Includes a brief history of aviation and information on what makes planes stay up.

results.title: Plan your maintenance
results.brief_description: The problem of maintenance in factories. An over-strained maintenance engineer collapses on the job, and the manager and his deputy set about selecting an assistant, to take over when the first man retires. Three candidates discuss the value of lubrication routine, spare parts in store, scheduling of maintenance, job cards and records, cost analysis, staff conferences and other factors. Underlying policy questions and personal attitudes come up in the course of the interviews and flashbacks to situations on the job.

results.title: Plan for living
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows scenes where early settlers landed in Australia; early views of the cities of Australia; construction of buildings post 1949 and general living conditions and development of the cities of Australia.

results.title: Plan for coal
results.creator_credit: Stuart Legg and Data Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the British coal industry; its history and significance from the first World War, through the depression of the 1930s to the present day. Some indication is given of long-term planning being carried out by the National Coal Board for the stabilisation and modernisation of the industry. Shows some of the new equipment being used. Narrated by Howard Crawford, Michael Goodliffe.
